DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a quadruple regimen (VX-222, telaprevir, pegylated interferon, and ribavirin)in subjects with hepatitis C with cirrhosis.
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Quadruple Therapy (VX-222, Telaprevir,Peginterferon-Alfa-2a, Ribavirin) in Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C With Compensated Cirrhosis
DOC.criteria: Subjects must have genotype 1 Chronic Hepatitis C Subjects must have compensated cirrhosis Subjects may either be treatment na√Øve, or may have received a course of Peg IFN/RBV without evidence of response. Subjects who are considered to be relapsers to Peg IFN/RBV, or who are partial or null responders will be considered Subjects with hemophilia may be permitted to enroll with permission of the medical monitor Any previous treatment with an investigational drug or drug regimen for the treatment of hepatitis C, or previous treatment with an approved protease inhibitor Any contraindication to PegIFN or RBV therapy Evidence of hepatic decompensation: history of ascites, hepatic encephalopathy, or bleeding esophageal varices A history of acquired immunodeficiency infection, organ transplantation or have an ongoing requirement for immunosuppressive medicines
